sense.gloss: to run away, to flee, to get away (e.g. from danger), to escape, to break out, to leave (e.g. one's spouse)
to avoid (a question, responsibility, etc.), to evade, to dodge, to shirk, to back away
to win without being overtaken, to hold off the other contenders (until the finish), to keep the lead (and win)
to escape (of heat, a gas, etc.), to leak out (e.g. of a scent), to be lost (e.g. of flavor)
to fail to hold an ideal posture
letting a good ball go by
escape, flight, running away, elopement, fleeing
to miss (e.g. a chance), to lose, to let get away
to set free, to let go
to miss, to overlook, to fail to notice
to let pass (a matter), to overlook (e.g. a wrongdoing), to turn a blind eye to
to let (a good ball) go by
to run away, to flee, to make off, to take to one's heels, to escape
way out, means to escape, escape route
(place of) refuge, escape, exit, way out, shelter, hiding place
to set free, to let go, to release
to miss (e.g. a chance), to lose, to let get away, to fail to catch
running off in the night (to leave one's old life behind, e.g. to get away from debt), moonlight flit, skipping town overnight, upping and leaving under the cover of darkness, midnight vanishing act
leaving a restaurant without paying, dine and dash, bilking
to run around trying to escape, to run from place to place
to take refuge in, to succeed in running away
to run about trying to escape
preparing to flee, being ready to run away
leaving a pub, restaurant, etc. without having paid for one's drinks
desertion in the face of the enemy, deserting under enemy fire
to make good one's escape, to escape to a safe place, to make one's getaway, to effect one's escape
to escape, to make one's getaway, to manage to get away
to miss (capturing), to fail to catch, to let slip
excuse, evasion, dodge, subterfuge, evasive answer
fleeing in all directions, (in Japanese history, a reference to) farmers who abandoned their fields and fled to the cities or other districts to evade onerous taxes
reaching first base safely due to opponent's error

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓はただ↑人生↑↓じんせい↓の↑問題↑↓もんだい↓から↑逃↑↓に↓げているだけだよ。
sdata.e: You're just running away from life's problems.

sdata.j: ↑逃↑↓に↓げよう。サツが↑来↑↓き↓てる。
sdata.e: We're getting out of here. The cops are coming.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓はなぜ↑逃↑↓に↓げ↑出↑↓だ↓そうとしたのですか。
sdata.e: Why did you try to run away?

sdata.j: このチャンスを↑逃↑↓のが↓す↑手↑↓て↓はないよ。
sdata.e: You had better avail yourself of this opportunity.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓はここからすぐに↑逃↑↓に↓げたほうがよい。
sdata.e: You had better get away from here at once.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓が↑早↑↓はや↓く↑決断↑↓けつだん↓をしなければ↑好機↑↓こうき↓を↑逃↑↓に↓がすことになるよ。
sdata.e: Unless you make a decision quickly, the opportunity will be lost.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓がそんなチャンスを↑逃↑↓のが↓すとは↑残念↑↓ざんねん↓だ。
sdata.e: It is a pity that you should lose such a chance.

sdata.j: ↑熊↑↓くま↓が↑眠↑↓ねむ↓ったり↑横↑↓よこ↓になるとき、その↑姿勢↑↓しせい↓は↑熱↑↓ねつ↓を↑逃↑↓のが↓したいのか↑保↑↓たも↓ちたいのかによる。
sdata.e: When bears sleep or lie down, their postures depend on whether they want to get rid of heat or conserve it.

sdata.j: ↑気違↑↓きちが↓いじみた↑愚↑↓おろ↓かな↑世俗↑↓せぞく↓の↑競争↑↓きょうそう↓から↑逃↑↓のが↓れたい。
sdata.e: I want to get away from the rat race.

sdata.j: ↑気↑↓き↓がつくと↑逃↑↓に↓げ↑場↑↓ば↓はどこにもなかった。
sdata.e: Now that I notice it, I have nowhere to run.

sdata.j: ↑奇跡↑↓きせき↓でも↑起↑↓お↓こらない↑限↑↓かぎ↓り、↑彼↑↓かれ↓はそこから↑逃↑↓に↓げられないんじゃないか。
sdata.e: He won't be able to escape from there without a miracle, will he?

sdata.j: ↑危険↑↓きけん↓を↑察知↑↓さっち↓して↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑逃↑↓に↓げた。
sdata.e: Sensing danger, he ran away.

sdata.j: ↑危険↑↓きけん↓な↑状態↑↓じょうたい↓にあるとき、↑彼↑↓かれ↓らは↑逃↑↓に↓げます。
sdata.e: When they are in danger, they run away.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓らは↑危機↑↓きき↓に↑瀕↑↓ひん↓すると、↑逃↑↓に↓げる。
sdata.e: When they are in danger, they run away.

sdata.j: ↑観客↑↓かんきゃく↓は↑金切↑↓かなき↓り↑声↑↓ごえ↓を↑上↑↓あ↓げて↑逃↑↓に↓げ↑去↑↓さ↓った。
sdata.e: With a scream, the spectators scattered.

sdata.j: ↑我々↑↓われわれ↓の↑最初↑↓さいしょ↓の↑攻撃↑↓こうげき↓で↑敵↑↓てき↓は↑逃走↑↓とうそう↓した。
sdata.e: After our first attack, the enemy fled.

sdata.j: ↑火事↑↓かじ↓だ！↑逃↑↓に↓げろ！
sdata.e: Fire! Run!

sdata.j: ↑何↑↓なに↓か↑逃↑↓に↓げる↑手↑↓て↓だてを↑考↑↓かんが↓えねばならない。
sdata.e: We must devise some means of escape.

sdata.j: わたしは↑彼↑↓かれ↓が↑逃↑↓に↓げていくのを↑観↑↓み↓た。
sdata.e: I saw him run away.

sdata.j: よく↑聞↑↓き↓かないと、↑彼↑↓かれ↓の↑言↑↓い↓う↑事↑↓こと↓を↑聞↑↓き↓き↑逃↑↓のが↓しますよ。
sdata.e: Listen carefully, or you'll miss what he says.

sdata.j: もし↑火事↑↓かじ↓が↑起↑↓お↓きたら、↑私↑↓わたし↓はフルートをもって↑逃↑↓に↓げるだろう。
sdata.e: If a fire should break out, I would make off with my flute.

sdata.j: もうすぐここから↑逃↑↓に↓げ↑出↑↓だ↓すのだ。
sdata.e: We're getting out of here in a moment.

sdata.j: みじめさに↑耐↑↓た↓えられないので、↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓は↑夫↑↓おっと↓から↑逃↑↓に↓げ↑出↑↓だ↓した。
sdata.e: Unable to bear her miseries, she ran away from her husband.

sdata.j: ママと↑私↑↓わたし↓はホールに↑逃↑↓に↓げたのよ。
sdata.e: Mummy and I moved into the hall.

sdata.j: まっすぐ↑行↑↓い↓けばわかります。↑見逃↑↓みのが↓すことはありませんよ。
sdata.e: Go straight ahead and you will find it. You can't miss it.

sdata.j: ぼんやり↑運転↑↓うんてん↓していたら、↑入↑↓はい↓っていく↑道↑↓みち↓を↑見逃↑↓みのが↓すよ。
sdata.e: If you drive carelessly, you will miss your turn.

sdata.j: フォックスは、↑映画↑↓えいが↓スターになる↑機会↑↓きかい↓を↑逃↑↓のが↓した。
sdata.e: Fox missed a chance to be a movie star.

sdata.j: なぜ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑逃↑↓に↓げたのですか。
sdata.e: Why did he run away?

sdata.j: どんなに↑速↑↓はや↓く↑走↑↓はし↓っても、↑自分↑↓じぶん↓の↑運命↑↓うんめい↓から↑逃↑↓に↓げ↑切↑↓き↓ることはできない。
sdata.e: Flee never so fast you cannot flee your fortune.

sdata.j: ↑泥棒↑↓どろぼう↓が↑逃↑↓に↓げた。
sdata.e: The thief ran away.
